body_html:
Hi,formath:
Try to add tensorflow/core/kernels/segment_reduction_ops.cc at the end of /xx/tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/makefile/tf_op_files.txt.

You can refer to #3543.

After doing this, the following error missed, but a new error emerges as listed in the appendix.
Invalid argument: No OpKernel was registered to support Op 'SegmentSum' with these attrs. Registered devices: [CPU], Registered kernels: <no registered kernels>

Hope that is useful to you

Appendix

Add graph to session successfully
Invalid argument: indices[0] = 384 is not in [0, 11)
	 [[Node: emb_6/embedding_lookup_sparse/embedding_lookup = Gather[Tindices=DT_INT64, Tparams=DT_FLOAT, _class=["loc:@emb_6/emb6"], validate_indices=true, _device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:CPU:0"](emb_6/emb6, _arg_input/sparse_6/id/Placeholder_0_9)]]

body:
Hi,formath:
Try to add `tensorflow/core/kernels/segment_reduction_ops.cc` at the end of `/xx/tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/makefile/tf_op_files.txt`. 

You can refer to https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/3543.

After doing this, the following error missed, but a new error emerges as listed in the appendix.
`Invalid argument: No OpKernel was registered to support Op 'SegmentSum' with these attrs.  Registered devices: [CPU], Registered kernels:
  <no registered kernels>`

Hope that is useful to you
  
#### Appendix 
```
Add graph to session successfully
Invalid argument: indices[0] = 384 is not in [0, 11)
	 [[Node: emb_6/embedding_lookup_sparse/embedding_lookup = Gather[Tindices=DT_INT64, Tparams=DT_FLOAT, _class=["loc:@emb_6/emb6"], validate_indices=true, _device="/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:CPU:0"](emb_6/emb6, _arg_input/sparse_6/id/Placeholder_0_9)]]
```
